Description: Fragment of pottery storage container, with moulded handle, or architectural piece. Dark red-brown fabric with purple core with much fine mica, and large quartz inclusions, organics, grog, black and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Nile silt consistent with local production, though could potentially be from elsewhere in the Nile Delta. Similar vessels without this decoration are common in Late Period sites in the region, probably for storing grain.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.079)
